com.versant.fund
Class VException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          java.lang.RuntimeException
              com.versant.odmg.ODMGRuntimeException
                  com.versant.fund.VException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChannelException, VSchemaException
public class VException
extends ODMGRuntimeException
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Class VException encapsulates a runtime database exception in the VERSANT Java binding. When operations on a VERSANT database fail, a VException is thrown. The VERSANT error number is encapsulated in the VException object.

See Also:
Serialized Form

          Constructs a VException with no detail message.

          Constructs a VException with the VERSANT error number.

VException(int err, java.lang.String str, HandleVector hvec)
          Constructs a VException with the VERSANT error number, error description and a handle vector containing objects that failed the database operation.

Method Detail

getErrno

public int getErrno()
Returns the VERSANT error number from the VException instance object.

Class VException extends RuntimeException. This method does not have to be run within a session.

See Also:
VException.toString(), VException.getFailedHandles(), VException.getFailedObjects()

getArgs

public java.util.Vector getArgs()
Returns the argument vector from the VException instance object.

This method does not have to be run within a session.

getFailedHandles

public Handle[] getFailedHandles()
Returns a Handle array of objects that failed the database operation.

Only certain database operations return failed objects in case of failure.

The following methods on FundSession may write objects to VException.

checkAllTimestamps()
checkpointCommit()
commit()

The following methods on HandleVector can write objects to VException:

checkpointCommit()
checkTimestamps()
commitAndRetain()
copyObjects()
groupDeleteObjects()
migrateObjects()

See Also:
VException.toString(), VException.getErrno()

getFailedObjects

public java.lang.Object[] getFailedObjects()
Returns a object array of objects that failed the database operation.

Only certain database operations return failed objects in case of failure.

The following methods on TransSession may write objects to VException.

checkAllTimestamps()
checkpointCommit()
commit()
checkpointCommit()
checkTimestamps()
commitAndRetain()
copyObjects()
groupDeleteObjects()
migrateObjects()

See Also:
VException.toString(), VException.getErrno()

getTimestampFailedObjects

public java.lang.Object[] getTimestampFailedObjects()
Returns a object array of objects those failed with error OM_TR_INVALID_TS during database operations like checkAllTimestamps OR checkTimestamps.

See Also:
VException.toString(), VException.getErrno()

getNotFoundObjects

public java.lang.Object[] getNotFoundObjects()
Returns a object array of objects those were not found during database operations like checkAllTimestamps OR checkTimestamps.

See Also:
VException.toString(), VException.getErrno()

Class VException extends RuntimeException. This method does not have to be run within a session.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Creates a clone of this VException.

A new instance is allocated and a bitwise clone of the current exception is placed in the new object.

Overrides:

    clone() in class Object

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
